page.title: 15ONE MAN AND HIS DOG
page.content: If you make your way towards the Holms of Ire along the{Simbuster Road},you may, once in a while, hear the{Gaelic cry{"Sirrahn ta rat taht"}as you pass the last house,{Arion .}This is the voice of{Mr.J.Stout}whose dog,{Lassie then proceeds to run up a wall, along the roof of his{byre}(barn) and round to his feet.His dog also fetches a ball when ordered and bangs on the telephone when asked to telephone Robbie Stout.{Jimmy Stout}was born at {W.Aing}on{Westray}and moved here in 1943.His wife{Jessie}was born at{Arion and they live here happily.{Jimmy}used to fish for{Cuithes}in{Roos Wick}but has stopped after a recent fall into the bay almost drowned him.They own 15 acres of land but let W.Tulloch graze cattle there.{Lassie}is now{nine}.They have a generator for electricity and will have mains installed by{May 1986.
